turns.content: how can i consciously determine what my subconscious has been programmed

It can be challenging to consciously determine what your subconscious mind has been programmed with, as much of this programming happens automatically and outside of our conscious awareness. However, there are some strategies you can use to gain insight into your subconscious programming:

1. Self-reflection: Take some time to reflect on your thoughts, emotions, and behaviors, and try to identify any patterns or themes that may indicate subconscious programming. Ask yourself questions like, "Why do I always react this way in certain situations?" or "Why do I have this belief about myself or the world?"
2. Journaling: Writing down your thoughts and feelings can help you uncover patterns and themes that may indicate subconscious programming. Try to write without censoring yourself, and see what comes up.
3. Mindfulness: Practicing mindfulness meditation or other forms of mindfulness can help you become more aware of your thoughts and emotions in the present moment, which can help you identify patterns and themes that may be related to subconscious programming.
4. Seek feedback from others: Sometimes, others can provide insight into our subconscious programming that we may not be aware of. Ask trusted friends or family members if they notice any patterns or themes in your thoughts, emotions, or behaviors.

By using these strategies, you may be able to gain a better understanding of your subconscious programming and begin to consciously reprogram any negative or limiting beliefs and behaviors.
lit top authorities on this and their credentials

There are many experts and authorities on the subject of the subconscious mind. Here are a few examples:

1. Sigmund Freud: Freud is often considered the father of psychoanalysis and was one of the first to study the subconscious mind. He developed many theories on the subconscious, including the idea that repressed memories and desires from childhood can influence behavior later in life.
2. Carl Jung: Jung was a Swiss psychiatrist and psychoanalyst who also contributed greatly to our understanding of the subconscious. He developed the concept of the collective unconscious, which refers to the shared memories and experiences of all humans, and believed that dreams could provide insight into the subconscious.
3. Bruce Lipton: Lipton is a cellular biologist and author who has studied the relationship between the mind and body. He believes that our beliefs and emotions can influence our biology and that we can reprogram our subconscious beliefs to improve our health and well-being.
4. Joe Dispenza: Dispenza is a neuroscientist and author who has studied the connection between the brain and the body. He believes that we can consciously reprogram our subconscious mind through practices like meditation and visualization.
5. Marisa Peer: Peer is a therapist and author who specializes in using hypnotherapy to access the subconscious mind. She believes that our subconscious programming can be changed by rewiring our thoughts and beliefs.

These individuals have different credentials and areas of expertise, but all have contributed to our understanding of the subconscious mind and how it influences our thoughts, emotions, and behaviors.

1. Napoleon Hill: Hill was a motivational writer and speaker who wrote the influential book "Think and Grow Rich." He believed that the subconscious mind was a powerful tool that could be used to achieve success and happiness.
2. John Kehoe: Kehoe is a Canadian author and speaker who has written extensively on the power of the subconscious mind. He believes that our thoughts and beliefs create our reality and that we can consciously reprogram our subconscious mind to achieve our goals.
3. Dr. Bruce Goldberg: Goldberg is a hypnotherapist and author who has written many books on the subconscious mind. He believes that past life regression therapy can help uncover and heal subconscious programming that may be causing problems in the present.
4. Dr. Wayne Dyer: Dyer was a motivational speaker and author who wrote many books on personal development. He believed that our thoughts and beliefs create our reality and that we can consciously change our subconscious programming through positive thinking and visualization.
5. Louise Hay: Hay was a motivational author and speaker who wrote extensively on the connection between the mind and body. She believed that our thoughts and beliefs can cause physical ailments and that we can heal our bodies by changing our subconscious programming.

These individuals and many others have made significant contributions to our understanding of the subconscious mind and how it can be used to achieve personal growth and success. Their work has influenced many fields, including psychology, neuroscience, and self-help.
